title: Ticket #1584: Remove compatibility checks for submitter/scheduler ads
description:
As an old compatibility hack, submitter ads sent to the collector by the schedd used to have a MyType of "Scheduler", but ClassAd::GetMyTypeName() would return "Submitter" if the ad really was a submitter ad. How did it distinguish between submitter ads and real scheduler ads? Scheduler ads have a NumUsers attribute and submitter ads don't.

Starting with Condor 7.3.2, we've been slowly separating the two ad types. See #1581 for a description of earlier changes. For 7.7.3, we fixed submitter ads from the dedicated scheduler to have the proper MyType (#2505). The goal for 7.9.x is to remove the remaining compatibility code.
